attributes.action: Keep 75p/month on electricity bills to continue Renewables NOT Fracking &Nuclear
attributes.additional_details:
By 2020 this 75p per month would have risen to less than £1.17 to maintain the current rate of renewables deployment.

Reference: DECC Report - Performance and Impact of the Feed-in Tariff Scheme: Review of Evidence:

See - Table 2 Page 7 - Impact on domestic bill

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/456181/FIT_Evidence_Review.pdf

Instead the alternative is Government propose to spend £25-Billion on Nuclear, using either Tax Payer's money or investment from China.

Nuclear will also need to be subsidised and so also add burden to energy bills.

Renewables make sense.
attributes.background:
